items.question: Is Art Palestine International's entire collection available online
items.answer: No. The API's preservation, digitization and documentation activities are ongoing. Users will be notified when new items are published online.

items.question: Is it OK to use images of items from the API collection?
items.answer: Yes, images can be used free of charge for personal research and artistic use. If an artwork using images from the API collection is sold, 10 % of the proceeds should be paid to the AIF. Please refer to the Image Use Policy for detailed information.

items.question: What if I need an image that is not available online, or not available in high enough resolution?
items.answer: You can write to us at use@artpalestine.org

items.question: Do you loan items in your collection?
items.answer: Original items can be loaned to institutions and museums that can ensure adequate environments in terms of security, climate control, light control, and suitable handling.Existing reproductions of items in the collection can be loaned to spaces with uncontrolled environments. The AIF can also handle requests for new reproductions, for a fee.

items.question: I am the custodian of an archive or collection of photographs. Can I donate them to the AIF and what is the procedure?
items.answer: We do accept donations. Contact us at: collections@arabimagefoundation.org

items.question: Is it OK to use images of items from the AIF collection?
items.answer: Yes, if an image is used for things like this its ok
